info.author: Colin Howe
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
===============
Hot File Finder
===============

Finds the 'hottest' files in a git repos history.

Hottest is defined as number of lines changed in a file excluding those lines
changed during creation/deletion of the file.

Output is a list of sorted filenames with their hotness score.

Can be useful for finding files that are likely culprits for being too big or
full of bugs and needing some serious love.

------------
Installation
------------

::

    $ pip install hotfilefinder

-----
Usage
-----

::

    $ cd somegitrepo
    $ hotfilefinder
    README.md 	21
    hotfilefinder/__init__.py 	8
    setup.py 	2

See ``hotfilefinder -h`` for more options.
info.name: hotfilefinder
info.summary: Finds the hottest files in a git repo
info.html_description:
Finds the ‘hottest’ files in a git repos history.

Hottest is defined as number of lines changed in a file excluding those lines changed during creation/deletion of the file.

Output is a list of sorted filenames with their hotness score.

Can be useful for finding files that are likely culprits for being too big or full of bugs and needing some serious love.

Installation

$ pip install hotfilefinder

Usage

$ cd somegitrepo

See hotfilefinder -h for more options.
